column4: Im trying to install e17 and when I go to config it it says svn not available, ive installed a few different svn and it still says not available
the package name it's subversion
Any subverison or should I get the DEV?
it should be the regular subversion package
Should I use apt-get or aptitude
CTRL ALT F1, sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
Thank you sir
How do I  start it again sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start?
yes, but if you are installing a new driver you need to reboot for it to be loaded
Thank you, whats the reboot command?
reboot :)
Thanks again here it goes
It kinda worked when I went to install it is said it Unable to build the NVIDIA kernel module
did you install "build-essential" and the linux headers ?
Im sure I have the build essentials where do I find the linux headers
Which linux headers
sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r)
linux-headers-2.6.27-7-generic is already the newest version.
What are the linux headers
you have those installed already, they are required to build kernel modules
I just did an apt-get an installed them
so it's fine, your problem is not missing headers
Hummmm Thats weird what does it mean nvidia kernel modual
